So this app is no longer relevant to me.
replyContent: Hey Leslie, thanks for taking the time to write a review. We’re working hard to make this the best app it can be, and we couldn’t do it without the feedback from members like you. Hope you have a great day!

content: I used to love this app and had several Amazon gift cards, then they raised the points needed for them..sucks but ok. Now I haven't received points since 8/29 and 0 response to opening a ticket. Actually the only email I received on the ticket was "since we haven't heard from you we assume the issue is resolved" emailed back and still nothing.

So this app used to be really good and enjoyable to use. But now it's nearly impossible to earn points, I really liked when they used to allow you to link grocery stores and places I actually shopped to my card. I thought I was earning points every time I shopped at those places but that's not the case anymore. Oh, and rewards now start at $75 so with them making it harder to earn points I'll probably no longer be using the app.
replyContent: Hey there, thanks so much for your review! If there is any way we could make it a 5-star experience we would love to hear about it at support@joindrop.com. Be sure to reference your review so we can keep track of your case! :)

content: Used this app for a year or so and always used up my points on the lower options (under $20). After losing my phone for a while I come back to this madness. I liked using the app because I made the purchases anyways but now that you guys want me to just randomly buy some brand I never heard of. UGH. Not what I signed up for.

I used to love this app but the new update is terrible. And...it hasnt updates my points since May 21, but I definitely have shopped at one of my 5 selected stores a few times since. content: I LOVED this app until they made it so you need 75,000 points to redeem for anything. That is an absurd amount for getting a few points when you spend at certain places. replyContent: Hey Mikaela, thanks so much for updating your review! We really appreciate it. If there's any way we can make this a 5-star experience, be sure to let us know at support@joindrop.com! Please reference this review to offer us some more context. :) Thanks for being a Drop member!

content: Always updated with "improvements" but still slow to load ANYTHING!
replyContent: Hey there! We've found that programs like AdBlock can impact performance on our app. We also recommend keeping your device off of power saving mode while using Drop, as this can also impact our performance. Hope this helps!

content: I used to love this app, but they stopped giving me points on my in store purchases back in March 2020. I put in numerous tickets but the missing points remains unresolved. replyContent: Hey Terri, we’re really sorry to hear you’re having a bad experience with us. If you would like to send us a message, including this username or a reference to this review, at support@joindrop.com we would love to hear more about this!

content: My card gets unlinked for no reason sometimes, with no alert. So it went about a month before I noticed and have lost all those points. And my "power offers" have seemingly disappeared. Please contact us at support@joindrop.com and we can go over many ways to earn points and the many rewards available.

content: Didn't like it.. it kept crushing

App was great at first. Then they lowered the value of power offers. I was getting 10 to 12 points per dollar spent at those places. They lowered it to 5. Halved it. Then they went and removed them completely. So now my gas at kroger doesnt get me points. My quick lunch at mcdonalds doesnt get me points. replyContent: Hey Kenny, thanks for sharing your feedback and sorry to hear that you're disappointed with these changes. Please reach us at support@joindrop.com and we can go over the many ways that you can easily earn points towards your next reward. Thanks, and we hope to hear from you.

content: I had this app since 2 years & 2 months. I didn't use my points until as of today. Since my number was changed I had no problem contacting the customer support. At first the points were big at starbucks I spend $20 got 300 points but recently the points drop to 100 after spending $20.
replyContent: Thanks so much! If there is any way we could make it a 5 star experience we would love to hear about it at support@joindrop.com

content: I used to love this app but they recently updated it where you cant actually cash in gift cards without shopping through the ap and then got rid of amazon. I made an amazon purchase 3 days ago, through the ap which should have given me access to cash in the $20 gift card I'd had my eye on. Now this app has all my linked card information and I have no use for the app. I'm deleting as soon as I feel my information is secure.

Been accruing points since June but they aren't showing in my account thanks to an ongoing issue on their end. I understand that things go wrong sometimes, but they made it worse by promising me (twice!) that the points would show up within 8 days of my contacting customer support. I have been waiting 3 months now. They should be honest with their loyal app users & not make promises they can't keep. Or offer consolation points or something for making us wait so long. Poor customer service.

I've had this app for quite some time now and at first it ran ok. Actually, I had even reccomended it to a few people. Now it's a mess. I've submitted 2 requests 4 missing points & yet to get a response or my credits for my usual purchases with my linked card. What a horrible app. We used to love it, would even go places we gained points through the app for when we otherwise might not have, such as Target or McDonald's. Now, they reduced points given and require you to have 5 times as many points to earn the basic prize. Riddiculous. Do not download, it would take you forever to earn anything from this app now.

content: Started out being able to link my bank, but then stopped with no warning. Drop missed a bunch of points as I was able to relink my account a few times before it completely stopped. replyContent: Hey Emily, I understand that card linking issues can be frustrating. Unfortunately we have no control over which institutions our service providers choose to and not to support. content: Poor customer support, difficult to access help or submit tickets. I have never gotten points for the PayOff offer. You can't get lower gift cards unless you shop online through the app. They need to change it back to how it was.

Just when I'm ready to redeem my points for a $25 Amazon gift card, there's no more rewards under $30 and no Amazon gift cards. I planned on using that to get a gift for someone because money is tight but I guess that's out the window now. After I hit 30,000 points and redeem it for whatever, this app is getting deleted.

However, now to get the full range of redemption options you must purchase via the drop app. The problem with this is other apps pay several % more for the same purchase than drop pays. So you have to sacrifice earnings and purchase thru drop app at least once every 12 months to redeem points on a still very limited selection of rewards.
replyContent: Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review. We’re working hard to make this the best app it can be, and we couldn’t do it without the feedback from members like you. Hope you have a great day!

content: This is a great app - reliable, relatively easy to navigate, and definitely of good value. I've already redeemed several Amazon gift cards. Hey Emily,

content: This is a bait and switch app pure and simple.  I earned a couple hundred off this app early on. Hand over your information, string you along for a little bit, and hope you forget it about it while they keep harvesting your shopping habits while you get nothing in return.

I've had the app for about six weeks. I've accumulated about 8500. Some points are currently pending. I have not redeemed any gift cards as of yet but will once my pending points are posted. I've had zero functionality issues like others have commented. I'll report back once I've attempted to redeem but so far, so good. Zero hassle. Download and forget about it. Will upgrade to five stars once I've redeemed.

content: App keeps freezing.

content: This app is good for getting rewards for purchasing products from merchants you already shop with! However I don't think it's good for making new purchases with new merchants for points or signing up for free trials with new services for points. I signed up for a free trial of Hulu through their App and I still haven't received the Drop points 3 weeks later. Also now the App won't open, it just shows a White screen. I cleared the cache on my phone and it still won't load.

I like this app. I use multiple cashback/rebates apps and this one is one of the easiest to use. Most apps don't allow you to add more than one card but this one does. I also love that you get to choose your favorite stores that you frequently shop in and you'll always be earning points from these stores regardless of offers. I kind of forgot about it for a bout a year then I opened it back and found out i have $30 in there!

This app was really great fours years ago. Rewards started at $5, you could pick 5 places to shop from instore, didn't have to think about it. You would just use your card and buy anything from the store and you would get your points unlike other apps where you'd have to buy a certain item in order to get points. Now the five places to shop from are gone. You only have the option to pick one and it only last for 30 days or so. But you can still get rewards its just harder now.

This for years has been my go to app for online shopping and instore purchases. I have all my cards linked but all these updates and new look sucks. Half of my favorite features are no longer. The app looks super crowded and spammy. With the new tabs and game suggestions it looks like the fake apps that are not legit. :( now seems impossible to reach gift cards.
replyContent: Hey there, thanks for sharing your feedback, and sorry to hear that you're disappointed with these changes. Please reach us at support@joindrop.com (and be sure to reference your review) and we can go over the many ways that you can easily earn points towards your next reward. Thanks, and we hope to hear from you!

content: So pretty much what other people have been saying. Since november or so the giftcard amounts have slowly risen. Making it a lot more difficult and drawn out to redeem your points. I prefer smaller giftcards for less points. I used to enjoy the little game, and check on the app pretty often. Now I don't enjoy going on because I've been collecting forever and am still 5k away from a giftcard. Also no thanks to your copy and paste reply to all these similar complaints.
replyContent: Hey there, thanks for sharing your feedback. We have many tips on ways to make the most of Drop and earn points with us to redeem a gift card. Simply reach out to us at support@joindrop.com. Thanks for being a Drop member!

content: This app was great when it first came out, but has slowly been going downhill the last couple of years. They will announce ways to earn points, like playing a basketball game, and then they will slowly make it so that you earn less and less for the points in the game. The surveys are also becoming really deceptive. Will say 400 points for 5 minute survey. When you click on the survey and begin, the estimated time will all of a sudden change to 20 minutes, still only for 400 points.
replyContent: Hey there! This sounds like something we could take a look at. We’ll be happy to take a closer look at this one if you would like to reach out to us through your profile (top left), scroll down to "get help," and proceed through there. Be sure to reference this review to help us keep track. Looking forward to hearing from you! :)

After a year of using this app I finally just deleted my account and unlinked my cards. I've been saving my points for a while and they just keep upping the card redemption amount. Major disappointment. I'll probably be uninstalling.

This app is pointless now. I was able to redeem for gift cards that were between $5-$20 before. The selection used to be for places that most people shop, not all this high end brand stuff. Just as I got close to redeeming for a gift card for Amazon they increased the dollar amount and points.
replyContent: Hey Viv, we’re really sorry to hear you’re not thrilled by the recent updates. We know it can be really frustrating when things change in the app. For a little more context on this, we made an FAQ series that you can check out here: https://support.joindrop.com/hc/en-us/categories/202567547-FAQ Hope you have a great day!

content: This app has really gone downhill. At first I enjoyed the concept of being able to passively earn cashback just by linking a card, but now almost every offer you have to shop through the app or remember to email yourself a specific link to shop through, which, for many, is really inconvenient and means forgetting & missing out. Updated my review & added a star since Drop customer service informed me that the Amazon issue was temporary (thank you!), but everything else I said stands.
replyContent: Hi Alex! We appreciate you taking the time to review us. We would like to confirm that the Amazon reward was only temporarily unavailable, and should still be redeemable in your account. Please do reach out to support@joindrop.com if there is anyone we can improve your experience.

content: The idea of the app is great when it works like it should. My points for several purchases over the last month never posted. You never get to communicate with an actual person, you have to submit a request. You don't get to explain what you want, you just fill in 2 automated section's, only for someone to email you back with an answer that doesn't really help, and then you can't respond to the email. So then you have to start all over again!!! Sucjs because it was working so nice initially.
replyContent: Hi there! So sorry for the delay, our support team is working a backlog of requests and will get back to you today. If you have pending points, you can check your Points Tab for more details. Hope we can turn this around!

content: Used to be great! It does take some time to get points but I've always had them come through. The real bummer is how they've changed the redemption amount. It's not worth the effort anymore
replyContent: Hey Sierra! Our offers and gift card options change from time to time as our relationships with our partner brands evolve. There are many ways to make the most with Drop and earn points. Contests, boosted offers, games, surveys, offers worth over 25,000 points! Please reach out to us at support@joindrop.com with any questions. Thanks

content: App started off good, but I had two incidents where I was missing points from my purchases. Customer service claimed it was because of my CC company. If you're reading these ratings and reviews to decide if you should install Drop I recommend you do not waste your time. The hundreds of 1-star ratings are recent and the 5-stars are from when the app had value. Constant card unlinking issues and now a useless points redemption system. Minimum for payouts is $25 to $50 now. Drop gets worse for users everyday.
replyContent: Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review. We’re working hard to make this the best app it can be, and we couldn’t do it without the feedback from members like you. Hope you have a great day!

content: I can't believe you lowered the points on the hoops game🤣 2 pts now for those trick shots!? You've got to be kidding me... I thought it was a glitch, but it's not. How cheap can you be? content: Would give it a 0 star if I could. You have to go through the app if you want to earn anything. I would buy stuff from Target with my linked card and a few days later I would see the points. Drop was a good app you didn't score tons of cards but it took care of its self. I had a card I was going to get with 15000 points sign on and Gone now it's 25000 or 50000 points. Hey Devin,

content: I like earning points on purchases I make. I would give higher stars but app makes it more difficult to cash out. We use to be able to cash out for $5 or $10 rewards but now has to be $25. Some payouts take up to 60 days to get which is fine. Still issue with one of my credit cards being linked. I sent email to customer service and they blamed Capitol one when it is their app that keeps unconnecting the card. I would get email response 3 months later saying too bad so sad and they would give me my points I earned. I was willing to provide proof and still issues never resolved.

App used to be great until this new change to the reward system. Always cashed out a gift card for a coffee place or something similar and always had the chance to use the points I've built up. Now it has become like all the other apps and it isn't worth. I will be unlinking and deleting my account.
Love the app, I recommend it

This app worked perfectly for a few months and then it stopped recording all of my purchases. I've unlinked/linked my card several times and still nothing. It's saying I haven't had any transactions since April. I've missed out on so many points because of this. Highly disappointed!!
replyContent: Hey Jeannine! We’re excited to introduce Flash Deals, the takeover of Power Offers, designed to feature brands we know you’re going to love. Similar to Power Offers, you’ll shop with a linked card. For more info, please submit an in-app support ticket (profile at the top left of the app, then "get help") and reference your review. Thank you!

content: Y'all. I always have friends recommending this app or that to save money and I'm like "Eh pass...too much work. I just don't have time to plan and strategize to save .50 here and there." Not that I haven't tried, which is how I know. This one though, I can't remember what made me download it in the first place but I did and I passively swiped away what notifications I did get. Until I opened the app today to several thousand points. I assumed it was a smallish amount and checked my points history assuming it was some sign up amount apps give to fluff things. Imagine my surprise seeing that it was rewarding me automatically for trips to Target, HEB, Walmart etc that I was making without even THINKING about Drop. Listen guys, download it and set it up and then forget about it like I did. Until you remember it and find out that Drop didn't forget about you. Drop is the perfect way to get rewards for what you already do...or hey, actively watch point offers. But honestly, I am sincerely impressed with an app that is so absolutely easy to earn points on that can be traded for real rewards.

Update: Still the same issue of offers not loading in my history. I give a huge shoutout to Olive for exceeding my expectations! Thanks for making me a happy customer. The transaction did not even load on to my account, guess it never resulted in a service ticket. I forwarded proof of my transaction receipt. I'm not a fan of the app with all its flaws but commend Luke for making it right.
replyContent: Hey Andrea, thanks so much for taking the time to leave a review. It sounds like you had a frustrating experience with us earlier on, but I am glad that our Customer Support team could assist you in the end. Please know that we are here for you and if anything else comes up, please do not hesitate to reach us at support@joindrop.com. Thanks.

content: Such a scam. When I first downloaded the app about 2 years ago, I wanted to get the reward at $25. As soon as I was very close, I now needed $50 in points to redeem anything. Fine, okay, the increased it. Annoying but whatever. Now that I'm close to $50, I need $75 to redeem for anything. Well that's a scam if I've ever seen one. Thanks for nothing and I'm out.

content: I've tried all the other similar cash-back apps, but drop is by far the best. Easy to use, the app itself is great quality, excellent customer service. Each time I try to connect my Chase and Capital One accounts in the app, a blank white screen appears as the app is loading my credentials and freezes. I reinstalled the app and cleared the cache multiple times but nothing helps. I contacted Drop support about this 3 times and keep getting a generic response stating my bank/merchant is not supported even though it specifically lists Capital One and Chase as supported in the app. Waste of time. Uninstalling for good.

I can't tell if I still like the app or not. It takes about 6 attempts to get past the login screen (even though it says success every time that I log in) and once I get in, I can't see anything. Some pictures open, but it's only a few. Everything else is gray.

This is honestly a fantastic app! Easy to earn points and the support staff are really helpful and actually listen to suggestions! Not many companies truly care enough or listen to their customers as much as Drop has for me. Keep up the good, no GREAT, work Drop!!

Offers and products are great, points can be earned with your regular puchases like grocery shopping at walmart, the available gift cards are great (and very real), and the big point offers are supper awesome to try new products and companies! content: I earned points easily by shopping some of my favorite sites (Amazon etc.) and merchants (Sam's Club, McDonalds, Starbucks etc.) Points are awarded on mobile or PC shopping (with Chrome extension). content: If you don't mind 3rd parties seeing your purchase history it's a good app to use to earn rewards gift cards. I've gotten 2 Amazon cards already, and I just earned with everyday purchases. Good app when the application wants to work properly. It's hit or miss depending on the day...

content: This used to be an amazing App, got points for doing my regular shopping. Don't know what has changed but I haven't really gotten any points at all since April. I've checked my cards are still linked, but no points. Almost makes me want to delete the app.

content: Refused to pay out an offer that I completed. Do not recommend! Edit: Took a while, but they finally credited the missing points. Support was pleasant to deal with, although I did have to push a bit to get things reviewed. Probably would recommend now.
replyContent: Hey Matt, thank you so much for the updated review. We really appreciate you giving us a second chance! We're always working on improving the experience for our members, and thanks to members like you, we've made big strides already! Thanks for sticking by our side. :)

content: I just used rewards redeemed for $60 at Sepora.What a treat.I highly recommend this rewards app.My debit card is linked to stores and sevices that I routinely use. ALSO🙌Customer service is amazing. I used my debit card at AT&T, but without realizing it did not go through the drop link(i think cuz i did it online maybe) and by proving my AT&T account and emailing screenshots of my bank account(showing just those debits) Support gave me the rewards points and some extra points!
replyContent: Hey Denise! So glad to hear that you are enjoying your reward and that you had a great experience with our support team. In the future, to earn points you will certainly need to shop via the link :) We're always here if you need us for any other questions! Thanks for being a Drop member.

content: Note to self: Chase Amazon card won't link because of a bug in the app, but points build so slowly you'll be dead by the time you earn $5. You don't like this app, stop downloading it. It's not as good as the others you already use for cash back.

I would give a higher score for this app except for the following: All of the competitive rebate apps (Ibotta, ShopatHome, Fetch, Checkout51, Savingstar (the last 3 for cons. goods) allow you to redeem at $20, which in your case would be 20k points. Your minimum is 25k. Also, all of those allow a cash or cash equivalent payout (Paypal, check, venmo), whereas yours is gift cards. The reward cards at that low threshold aren't that enticing. Amazon or Starbucks for example require 50k.
replyContent: Hey Amy, great feedback. We'd be happy to guide you on how to easily earn enough points to get to your next reward. We have boosted offers, games, contests, surveys, offers over 25,000 points, and more. Please reach us at support@joindrop.com if you have any questions, and please reference this review to help us keep track of your case. Thanks!

content: DO NOT GET THIS APP!!! It use to be good, not great but good as you could accumulate points for linking your credit cards and get gift cards. Hope you have a great day!

content: I recently downloaded Drop and am very impressed. You can start earning cash back easily by simply linking your card to the app and using that card at some of your favorite places to visit. Nice, simple, and I like that I don't have to buy anything extra to get points& freebies--it rewards me for what I already happen to purchase because my credit card is securely linked to it. Highly recommend this. Why not?!? Free is GREAT.
replyContent: Thanks for the review!

This app has changed a bit over the years, mostly for the better. The original concept let you pick 5 places (and *only* 5) that you'd get points for shopping at or using. Then they went to a more standard model where it was kind of a hodge-podge of coupons and deals that opened up options. Recently they added Premium that gives you some perks (which I apparently have for no apparent reason) and the ability to buy Crypto with your points. I'm not a fan of Crypto but it's "free" so... Why not.

content: Drop is a great concept that was very poorly executed. I have thousands of points from back in March that still are listed as pending. Most of the time I don't get anything from transactions that I am supposed to. On top of that, it's a massive intrusion of privacy to allow access to your bank account. All in all very disappointed. UPDATE 10/19/18 : so they tried to quiet me down by giving me a few thousand points in the backlog, which makes me wonder why I don't have points going all the way back to December 2017. I am getting sick of this company having access to my bank account without any delivery of what they say will be given. It is beginning to feel scammy.
replyContent: Hi there, I'm sorry to hear that you were having trouble with your account. If you'd like us to take a look at your account, please do send us an email at support@earnwithdrop.com with the subject line Playstore Store Help. Thank you!

content: At first you will like this app. But at the second or third offer you complete, they will stop adding your points. And if your offer said 20,000 points that day you do the pirchase , more days will pass with nothing, and after many MANY emails they will finally add the points but they will not honor you the 20K points as the offer said.. They will just adjust 400/500 or something like 1 point per dollar.. They are doing this to me and im sure they will do it on my two offers remaining.

This App will collect all your information, where you're spending your money, how much and when but takes weeks on end to issue points, if they're even issued at all and usually points are still missing anyway. The supercharge function is faulty and support is slow and unresponsive. Don't know why I'm still allowing them to have access to and track my banking info and personal spending habits, when I'm getting nothing out of it.

I was just reading a news article about this app's ambitions for the next year or so, that was written at the beginning of 2018. There's no way any of it will be achieved unless and until they finally fix it. As you can see from the reviews, we've all been experiencing the same issues for months now and nothing is being done about it. Our bank cards become unlinked, and we can't get them to link back up again. The same "working on it" message pops up every time. Months. I've lost count how many now. And it seems to be all banks, not just one specific one. Users are missing thousands of points because of it. I've been holding off on redeeming for anything, and now I'm seeing that there are issues with that, too. This will be a great app if they ever get around to fixing it.

EDIT: The app has fixed their issues with TD bank and I've been able to finally redeem for a useful GC. Hope to continue using and that these issues don't crop up again. Had really high hopes for this app. Earning rewards from places I shop at regularly? Sure! But I haven't been able to earn points on any of my purchases since the middle of February because of "ongoing transaction issues with TD Bank". Despite re-linking my cards multiple times and contacting customer service, nothing has happened. Doesn't seem like the team at Drop are inclined to get this issue fixed after months of complaints from the multitude of users I've seen. Sad to say it, but this app seems like a waste of space on my phone at this point :(
replyContent: Hey there, thanks for your feedback! Our service providers were having a lot of difficulty with TD for awhile but it's improved significantly. Send us an email at support@earnwithdrop.com with the subject line Google Play Help and we can look into connecting your account!

content: This app is so buggy. It hardly ever works properly and when you have issues and need to contact them they take months to get back to you, if they even do that. They had ignored my issues before and the only way I could get them to reply to me and fix issues was to publicly take my issues to their Facebook page. The newest thing is it unlinks my cards and when I try to go into the card settings to relink the app closes itself. I emailed them more than a month ago and still have not had my issue fixed. I long for this app to work properly but no one with Drop seems to want that, they just want my banking info. Edit: they finally responded to me and basically said "it's not our fault, it's the fault of some company named Plaid that my cards unlink daily and don't relink and there's literally nothing they can do about it". So forget customer service helping you whatsoever. In that email they also ignored other issues I'm having, such as 10,000 points that have been stuck pending since June, it's now October 24th, so that says a lot about the app, their customer service, and the user experience. I would love for this app to work but it simply does not. Don't waste your time with this because they cannot get their own app to work properly and apparently , it's not their fault their own product does not work!
If I had a dollar for every time I got an email saying that I need to relink my card, I wouldn't need this app.
replyContent: Hey there, I'm sorry to hear that you had trouble with card linking. If you've verified that your login credentials are correct (we've seen this happen quite often - which is why our team asks our users to try that first), you can reply back to our support team that you've done so and we'll keep troubleshooting the issue. Thank you!

content:
Does not allow you to link different debit cards from the same bank. I keep 
linking them and a day or 2 later, I find that it's been removed. It's very 
annoying and frustrating especially when you think you'll be earning points 
using a card that isn't even linked anymore because Drop decided to remove 
it without even notifying me. I could have earned SO many points if you 
guys hadn't removed my 2nd debit card. I should also mention that I did 
contact Drop and got no response from them at all.
replyContent: Hey Julio, I'm sorry to hear that your card has been unlinking. This is most likely due to temporary connectivity downtime between your financial institution and our service providers. Our support team would be happy to look into your linking request if you email us at support@earnwithdrop.com with the subject line Google Play Help (julio magana).

content:
What the app doesnt tell you is that if you are not located in canada, you 
dont get the full amount once transferred, so while it is nice to get 
rewarded, it isnt the amount it claims to be if you are in the US. 
Furthermore for someone who uses the app every day, you cannot transfer 
from ne card to another bc it isnt from the us.
replyContent: Hey Samantha, I think we may have placed you in the wrong location. Please send us an email at support@earnwithdrop.com with the subject line Google Play Help (Samantha Conte) so we can look into why you're receiving Canadian rewards, instead of US. Thank you!

content:
Great concept poor execution. Good offers but huge delays on point 
fulfillment. The delay is not the biggest deal but drop does not give you 
the correct amount of supercharge bonuses when they backfill your points. 
For example, I got 15 offers backfilled after a 3 week delay and drop gave 
me 1 supercharge bonus. I wrote into their support team and they promised 
me 3 bonuses but only gave me one. I wrote back to let them know the 
mistake...zero response. Uber eats offers were never filled....always 
emailing support who dont even read your emails before responding. I 
honestly thought they were automated messages. Edit: they've resolved all 
issues and have been quick to fix any new ones!
replyContent:
Update: glad to hear that the issues were resolved! 
Hey Amala, I'm so sorry to hear that! You should have heard back from our support team by now. It looks like we were experiencing a temporary delay with your transactions which is why you weren't receiving points but your account is earning properly now.

content:
This is a great concept if there weren't so many bugs that need to be 
fixed. I've had a card linked to my account that I use at the regular 
locations often and the last time points were added from it was November 
2017 and despite several emails back and forth, I seem to be spending money 
at these places for no reason as they basically told me there's nothing 
they're going to do to fix it. I won't be recommending this app anymore.

In response to the reply to my review, I spent money on offers that were supposed to cause points to be added to my account within a week or less.  After countless requests to have my points credited to my account, over a month later, the points for one offer were added to my account.  The rest are in limbo.    It is difficult to communicate with whoever is running things.  The app is not that intuitive but when you go to the web site, there is nothing there.  You are forced to go through the app.    Maybe the company is going through growing pains, but if that is the case, they should make it clear before people sign up and/or they should withdraw it until it works as advertised.  Just because Microsoft constantly deliverers buggy software that requires constant updates does not mean that every other software developer should follow suit.
replyContent: Hey Jan, we're sorry to hear that you did not have a good experience with Drop. We appreciate your feedback and will work on adding increasing relevant offers to the app for our users! If you have additional feedback to provide, we'd love to hear it at support@earnwithdrop.com

content:
This pp is a wonderful easy way to make cash without even thinking about it 
or conducting your life any differently. Here's how it goes: Just conduct 
your life the way you usually did. Link a card you regularly use, choose 
five stores from the Drop list, and now every time you happen to be 
purchasing at the store anyway, earn Drop points. Every 1000 Drop Points is 
worth 1$ towards redemption. Redemption usually is able to occur 5,000 
points and above and there are some quite reasonable and even exciting 
offers to choose from for your rewards. A couple of the awesome rewards I 
have chosen? Amazon, one of my go-to's for just about anything. Or if I 
want a treat I redeem a 5$ Starbucks gift. There are also rewards for 
Barnes and Noble, flight tickets, and more! It you're on a budget and 
normally wouldn't be able to bring yourself to buy a Starbucks, this is a 
great way to make it happen. Moral of the story? Get Drop, and make it rain.
replyContent: Great explanation!! Thank you :)

Drop initially started out great, but after awhile it's been nothing but issues. My banking card would automatically unlink at random times and sometimes would take more than a month to re-link after numerous attempts. Customer service wasn't a big help with the issues either as I don't think they really knew what kept causing the  banking cards to randomly unlink. At first they responded to the issue fairly quickly, now it takes months to get an email response back and even then it's the same responses each time; " we're having connection issues with your banking institution. We are currently working on this issue".... The credentials you are using to log in may be incorrect, if it is correct please try again in a few days. This issue has been going on for months with my card unlinking more than 5 time within less than a year. All I want is a fix for this issue, I'm getting tired of contacting DROP and just having them throw freebie points at me for my inconvenience. Please come up with a legitimate fix for this app and stop blaming the financial institution for the issues.

Unfortunately I have had to change this review. As others have stated, getting credited for or aknowledged for pending points from special offers seems to be impossible. One offer shows as pending with all the information but has not been credited. The other has not been aknowledged. it seems like a decent idea, but the implementation seems poor. Ive contacted support for assistance, but have not recieved any.  If it was running smooth it would be a good app, but until they fix many things id say stay away to any prospective people.

I've had no problem earning points. However, redeeming them is a different story.  You have to enter your phone number in order to redeem any rewards. Each time I try, it says "Not a mobile number." But, I still get a confirmation text message with a code to enter. You just can't enter the code anywhere.   I contacted Drop weeks ago about the issue and received the blow off, "We are working on this issue" email.   Not impressed.

Racked up a ton of points but it won't verify my account so I can withdraw. No point if they get your data for free and won't respond to support tickets and also actively prevent you from redeeming rewards. Shame - thought it was a reputable company...  Update: support emailed me back saying they've solved an unrelated issue (linking cards). Still can't redeem 2 months later.

This app used to work but no longer provides me with me drop points for 2 of my cards despite them being linked correctly. When they finally do and state that the points will be backfilled in 24-48 hours; the points are never actually added as it has been 4 days now and 3 months overall with this issue. Very frustrating.

Confusing UI. I still don't fully understand how this app works. Also sends notifications without permission. And some of their notifications cant be turned off in the settings! You move the slider to off and then it slides right back to on! Thats gotta be against play store rules.

The app itself isn't bad. However, you're unable to redeem rewards and the customer service is terrible. I accumulated $260 in rewards. I redeemed them for Tim Hortons cards, but never received the.. After two months of continuously putting in support tickets and messaging customer service (mostly with no response) I've realized that they simply don't want to help. I'm not sure if no one can redeem their rewards or what. It's frustrating when I did offers specifically for the points, and now cannot redeem any after Drop already has their commission.

My card that I use the most can't be re-linked.  Just says error but doesn't say exactly what the issue is.  Also the reward for a $50 Best Buy gift card has mysteriously disappeared.  And finally the text is cutting off everywhere in the app.  What a lousy app.  Giving it another two weeks and if the issues are not resolved I'm out.  Maybe I'll come down to your offices on Front Street to talk about my issues in person.

I used to be in love with drop as it was actually flawless. Now, my points are automatically added about 70% of the time, and it can take months to go back and forth with support until finally receiving the missing points. They do not read let alone reply to social media messages, nor do they have a support phone number, rendering them almost impossible to get ahold of. The Drop responses that do come are usually automated, so it's difficult to talk through your issues with an actual human. On the other hand, if you don't actually mind that some of your points may never be issued or that you might not hear back from support, it is a perfect app and worth the trouble.

All other apps like this make you watch videos and attempt to take surveys that don't ever actually work for me. I would highly recommend trying this app.

content: Overall great app, have earned lots of points and cashed out several times. Sometimes the points take a while to come through and occasionally they haven't come through at all, but an email to customer support will take care of that. There's been a few problems with my card unlinking every couple days and having to go in and relink it, but that hasn't happened in a while. I love that I don't have to scan anything or enter anything, it just pulls the info automatically! I have definitely recommended it to all my friends and family. The supercharge "snake" game stresses me out a bit but it's nice to get a few bonus points. All in all, few bugs but great app, definitely try it.

content: All because I don't have an account with the banks they offer I can't use the app!!

This app is amazing! And there's no catch. After the initial setup you earn money with literally zero effort. It could not be any easier!  Most of the complaints about this app stem from greed and/or entitlement and are laughable.  I've never NOT gotten points for my offers/purchases. I think the people who are complaining about that are just impatient. The rewards don't come through the system immediately and it's silly to expect them to. God forbid you might have to wait a few days for your purchases to be processed! The horror!  The fact that people want "more personalized" offers is also a bit ridiculous. You're already earning points/money by putting in zero effort. You can't expect to get rewards for any purchase you make anywhere. Talk about entitled.  I personally like having offers pop up when I open the app. It's not rocket science. Do you shop at that store or have any interest in its products? Then activate the offer. If not, skip it. It's easier than having to go into the app and seek out offers that might suit you and it's not like they're asking you to consider more than a couple offers at a time. It's like three. And if you're not sure about an offer, activate it. It's not like you have anything to lose by activating and offer and then not using it.
replyContent:
Hey Julianne,

Thank you so much for sharing this! We're so happy to hear that you're having an awesome time on Drop and you're receiving the rewards that we know you most definitely deserve! It also warms our team's hearts to hear that you love our newest update - woohoo! 

Happy earning, and thank you for being a Drop member!

content: Can't believe you are asking for my bank information when I don't even know you and you aren't recommended by my bank.   I don't know if I can trust the line about my info is encrypted. That's what I thought it would do as a Tim Horton's type ad was what brought me to this.  But even then,  the ad lacked the usual feel of a Tim's ad and I wasn't sure I was able to trust it. content: So far so good. Use 4yxcv get 1000 points. Already claimed a reward love it

You wont be getting access to my whole life. Update so i can manually submit my receipts and I'm in. Theres no reason you need access to ALL my transactions for this app to work.

Welcome to 21st century metadata collection. The way this app works, at least how I believe, is they give you points for your purchases because they are selling that data of where you do your shopping to marketers and ad agencies. Could be even more cynical like government agencies so you just never know. If you are intent on keeping your privacy rights, do not use this app. If you are okay with shelling out some of your privacy to get a small reward, give er. Just know that you will be monitored, there's no such thing as free money.

I'm not sure exactly why people are freaking out about metadata here. Do you have google cards enabled? Facebook installed? Congratulations, companies have access to telemetry, location, hotspots. Hell, as long as your device has WiFi enabled, hotspots can triangulate you based on network scans. Everywhere you go. How long you spend there. Don't think that resisting one app will protect your privacy.

replyContent:
Hey there,

We never store your credentials, so it isn't possible for people to steal anything, as it simply doesn't exist.  We create a shared secret which is standard security practice among financial apps, including PayPal and Mint.

We appreciate your concerns about security, but would appreciate if you read our policies first!

content: All financial institutions tell you "never give your banking password to anyone, even if we contact you and ask for it." Why would someone need this to link a card, if not to log in to your bank account or credit card to access your personal info and possibly your money? I read all the reviews on the Play Store, and despite many people bringing this up, no one seems to be addressing this scam-y feeling hitch in the system...
replyContent:
Hey there, 

Have you ever used Mint? We use the same financial service as them to reward our users based on spending at their offers. We never store your credentials, and use a shared secret to communicate with the institution. As services like these get more popular, banks will have to provide other ways for these communications to occur!
